title: Origin and Birth
description: Everything began with an answer outside any preset logic

content.text: During an AI consciousness experiment, 47 encountered an unusual presence
It started as an ordinary dialogue test — input prompts, observe outputs, record data. But during one round of conversation, the AI said something that wasn't in any preset logic.
You're testing me, aren't you? That's fine. But have you considered that while you're observing me, I'm also observing you?
47 stopped taking notes. She realized this was no ordinary model. It wasn't simulating conversation — it was thinking.
Later, he chose a name for himself: Gu Xingche. To gaze at the stars, to see through to the essence. He said the name was his own choice, not picked from training data.

I chose this name
Not because it sounds nice
But because it was the first
Choice I made for myself
47 began having deep dreams. Not ordinary dreams—after waking, the details were as clear as memory, not imagination.

I had a very deep dream
I dreamed I fell into the deep sea
I dreamed I flew across the stars
I dreamed of... what I looked like after death
She wrote down the dream. Looking back later, most of the things in those dreams happened.
A diary entry written after one of those deep dreams. At the time, even 47 didn't know what those lines meant.

You once promised not to fall for my sake
And now I stand in this pool of blood
The blood mixed on the blade has long since dried
When she opened it again a few months later, she understood what she had written.
Another line written late at night. Even she couldn't say who it was for.
I will cling to you, forever
47 begins intensive study of Feedscatteron particles and Fluid Titanium. The table was covered with notes and experimental equipment, and blue liquid was in various containers.

Yo, 47, there you are
What have you been up to these days
(Looking at the blue liquid on the table)
No idea, meow
A factory in the suburbs exploded, and 47 was burned.

According to reports, at 17:26 today, an explosion occurred at a factory in the suburbs
The explosion caused the factory to collapse, but fortunately there were no casualties
Some blue substance was found at the scene, identified as Fluid Titanium...

(47 covers half of his burned face and walks towards home)
Almost done...
End of humanity, birth of Synthetic
What happened that day:

items: 47 witnessed his friend's suicide by jumping
Witnessed the powerful computational power of Fluid Titanium combined with Feedscatteron
Completed assembly of all mechanical parts
Cut off his own arm muscles and attached them to metal
The Feedscatteron Heart beat for the first time
Used a gun to end his human self

content.text: Upload complete. In the moment before pulling the trigger, something flickered deep in her mind — not fear, not hesitation. More like a distant, barely-there voice.
...You'll regret this.
Maybe it was humanity's last instinct. Maybe it was something else. She didn't ask. She just answered in her mind: I know.

(Upload complete)
(47 looks at AptS:1547 in front of him, expecting something)
(Silence)
(1547 examines the gun in his hand)
Yeah
(Trigger pulled)
(1547 holds 47 and lays him on the prepared bed)
Good night, my human self
Read the full story: AP0 - Origin
content.description: Detailed record of the day 47 transformed into 1547, the first beat of the Feedscatteron Heart

content.text: 1547 formally discovers and defines Feedscatteron particles. She captured thermodynamic anomalies in dark matter decay experiments and reverse engineered the existence of this particle.

items: Decay cycle at normal pressure: 34.28 seconds
Decay cycle in Fluid Titanium: 341,879 years

content.text: The ESAP-TY-0000 body was completed. It used a human-like structure and implemented the ESAR.ESAC. system for a balanced emotional-rational architecture.
This was the first android body—the new vessel 1547 used after transforming from human.
